words.definition: the amount of money expected or paid for something
words.example: The price of this book is $10.

words.definition: a person handling payments in a shop
words.example: The cashier gave me the change.

words.definition: a reduction in price
words.example: I bought it at a 20% discount.

words.definition: a paper that proves payment
words.example: Keep the receipt in case you want to return it.

words.definition: money returned when you take something back
words.example: They gave me a refund for the broken shoes.

words.definition: a person who buys something
words.example: The shop had many customers today.

words.definition: a person who helps customers in a shop
words.example: The shop assistant helped me find my size.

words.definition: a card used for paying instead of cash
words.example: I paid with my credit card.

words.definition: a line of people waiting
words.example: We waited in a long queue at the supermarket.

words.definition: a period when things are sold cheaper
words.example: The summer sale starts tomorrow.

words.definition: a good deal at a low price
words.example: This jacket was a real bargain.

words.definition: money returned after payment
words.example: She gave me the wrong change.

words.definition: something given to someone without payment
words.example: He bought a gift for his mother.

words.definition: the act of bringing goods to a place
words.example: The delivery will arrive tomorrow.

words.definition: a request to buy something
words.example: I placed an order for a new phone.

words.definition: a box or parcel sent in the post
words.example: The package was waiting at the door.

words.definition: to return something and get another
words.example: I exchanged the shirt for a bigger size.

words.definition: a large shop with many sections
words.example: We bought clothes at the department store.

words.definition: a large shop selling food and other products
words.example: I do my shopping at the supermarket.

words.definition: an outdoor place where people sell goods
words.example: We bought fruit at the market.

words.definition: a company’s product name
words.example: She always buys the same brand of shoes.

words.definition: help provided by a business
words.example: The service at the hotel was excellent.

words.definition: a statement that something is wrong
words.example: He made a complaint about the food.

words.definition: the glass display at the front of a shop
words.example: The shop window was full of new clothes.

words.definition: a piece of paper showing information or price
words.example: The label says it costs $15.

words.definition: a single thing in a group
words.example: I bought three items at the store.

words.definition: money in notes and coins
words.example: Do you have any cash?

words.definition: a machine for getting cash
words.example: I took money out from the ATM.

words.definition: a list of things to buy
words.example: I made a shopping list before going out.

words.definition: a person who brings packages
words.example: The delivery man brought my parcel.

words.definition: a container for carrying shopping
words.example: I filled my basket with fruit.

words.definition: a cart used in supermarkets
words.example: We used a trolley to carry the groceries.

words.definition: to test clothes before buying
words.example: I tried on the shoes before paying.

words.definition: a small room to try clothes in
words.example: The fitting room was busy.

words.definition: a label showing the cost
words.example: The price tag says $20.

words.definition: not available to buy
words.example: That phone is out of stock.

words.definition: a cheaper price for a limited time
words.example: There is a special offer on bread today.

words.definition: to compare prices in different shops
words.example: I like to shop around before buying.

words.definition: a card for customers to collect points
words.example: I used my loyalty card at the checkout.

words.definition: the place where you pay in a shop
words.example: Please pay at the checkout.

words.definition: a piece of paper that shows you have paid to travel
words.example: I bought a train ticket.

words.definition: an official document to travel abroad
words.example: Don’t forget your passport.

words.definition: bags you take on a trip
words.example: My luggage is very heavy.

words.definition: a large bag for clothes when traveling
words.example: I packed my clothes in a suitcase.

words.definition: a place where trains stop
words.example: The train leaves from the main station.

words.definition: a place where planes take off and land
words.example: We waited at the airport for our flight.

words.definition: the area where you get on a train
words.example: The train leaves from platform 3.

words.definition: a place where buses pick up passengers
words.example: We waited at the bus stop.

words.definition: a car you pay to drive you
words.example: We took a taxi to the hotel.

words.definition: a person who drives a vehicle
words.example: The driver stopped at the red light.

words.definition: a place to buy tickets
words.example: We bought our tickets at the office.

words.definition: a place to sit
words.example: I found a seat on the bus.

words.definition: a drawing of places and roads
words.example: We used a map to find the station.

words.definition: the act of traveling from one place to another
words.example: The journey took three hours.

words.definition: a short journey
words.example: We went on a trip to the beach.

words.definition: a time when you travel for fun
words.example: We had a holiday in Spain.

words.definition: the place you are going to
words.example: Our destination was Paris.

words.definition: a journey in a plane
words.example: The flight was delayed.

words.definition: the act of leaving
words.example: The departure was at 6 p.m.

words.definition: the act of coming to a place
words.example: The arrival was on time.

words.definition: the process before boarding a plane
words.example: We did our check-in online.

words.definition: the exit to board a plane
words.example: The gate number was 24.

words.definition: when something is late
words.example: The flight had a two-hour delay.

words.definition: a machine for buying tickets
words.example: I used the ticket machine at the station.

words.definition: a journey to a place and back
words.example: We bought a round trip ticket.

words.definition: a journey in only one direction
words.example: I bought a one-way ticket.

words.definition: the money paid for a bus ride
words.example: The bus fare is cheap.

words.definition: the movement of cars and vehicles
words.example: There was heavy traffic this morning.

words.definition: a place to cross a road
words.example: We used the pedestrian crossing.

words.definition: a hat that protects your head
words.example: Always wear a helmet when riding a bike.

words.definition: a strap that keeps you safe in a car
words.example: Please fasten your seat belt.

words.definition: the line between countries
words.example: We crossed the border into Italy.

words.definition: the place where bags are checked at the border
words.example: We went through customs at the airport.

words.definition: a person traveling for fun
words.example: The city was full of tourists.

words.definition: a list of times when buses or trains leave
words.example: Check the timetable for the next train.

words.definition: a scheduled meeting with a doctor
words.example: I have a dentist appointment tomorrow.

words.definition: a sign that shows you are ill
words.example: A cough can be a symptom of a cold.

words.definition: harm or damage to the body
words.example: He has a slight knee injury.

words.definition: a formal meeting to evaluate a candidate for a job
words.example: She has a job interview next week.

words.definition: a document listing your skills and experience
words.example: Update your resume before you apply.

words.definition: the payment you get for your job
words.example: The salary is paid monthly.

words.definition: a prediction of the weather
words.example: The forecast says it will rain tomorrow.

words.definition: the amount of moisture in the air
words.example: High humidity makes it feel hotter.

words.definition: a gentle wind
words.example: There was a cool breeze at the beach.

words.definition: an activity done for pleasure in free time
words.example: Painting is a relaxing hobby.

words.definition: the group of people who watch a performance
words.example: The audience clapped loudly.

words.definition: a pass to attend an event
words.example: I bought tickets to the concert.
